item.title: 俄新社报道，俄罗斯封杀 Snapchat
item.description: 据国营新闻社 RIA 周四援引俄罗斯通信监管机构 Roskomnadzor 的消息报道，俄罗斯已阻止 Snapchat 的访问。【原文：Russia has blocked access to Snapchat, state-run news agency RIA reported on Thursday, citing the country's communications regulator, Roskomnadzor.】

item.title: 美国矿产项目寻求华盛顿更多支持，以与中国竞争
item.description: 三位美国矿业和精炼业高管周四表示，华盛顿必须加快项目许可和融资，以抵消中国对全球用于制造电子产品、武器和一系列其他商品的矿产供应的广泛控制。【原文：Washington must speed up permitting and financing for projects to offset China's broad sway over the world's supply of the minerals used to build electronics, weapons and a range of other goods, three U.S. mining and refining executives said on Thursday.】

item.title: LVMH集团的接班人？阿尔诺的妻子说：我们不谈论这个问题
item.description: 据法国《解放报》周四刊登的奢侈品巨头路威酩轩集团首席执行官贝尔纳-阿尔诺（Bernard Arnault）的妻子的言论称，控制权在阿尔诺家族内部很少讨论接班计划。【原文：Succession plans at luxury giant LVMH are seldom discussed within the controlling Arnault family, according to remarks by CEO Bernard Arnault's wife published in France's Liberation newspaper on Thursday.】

item.title: 亚马逊在美国航运市场的影响力与日俱增
item.description: 亚马逊对新履约中心和配送站的投资逐渐巩固了这家网络巨头在近 1930 亿美元的美国包裹业中的重要地位，该行业长期由 UPS、联邦快递（FedEx）和美国邮政服务（U.S. Postal Service）主导。【原文：Amazon's investments in new fulfillment centers and delivery stations have gradually cemented the online giant's position as a key player in the nearly $193 billion U.S. parcel industry, long dominated by UPS , FedEx , and the U.S. Postal Service.】

item.title: 中国长安汽车高管表示，将在两年内向欧洲推出 Avatr 和 Nevo 电动汽车品牌
item.description: 中国长安汽车公司全球设计总监周四表示，该公司将在未来两年内在欧洲推出电动汽车品牌 Avatr 和 Nevo，并考虑在欧洲大陆销售轻型商用车。【原文：China's Changan will launch vehicles from its electric Avatr and Nevo brands in Europe over the next two years and is considering selling light commercial vehicles on the continent as well, the automaker's global design chief said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国参议员希望航空公司向长时间延误的乘客支付现金
item.description: 由 15 位民主党参议员组成的小组周四提议立法，要求航空公司在航班严重延误时提供现金补偿。【原文：A group of 15 Democratic senators proposed legislation Thursday to require airlines to provide cash compensation if carriers cause significant delays.】

item.title: Stellantis 首席执行官称混合动力车是美国市场的重中之重
item.description: Stellantis 首席执行官安东尼奥-菲罗萨（Antonio Filosa）周四表示，该汽车制造商正专注于在美国市场生产混合动力车型，这与他的前任专注于全电动车型的做法有所不同。【原文：Stellantis CEO Antonio Filosa said on Thursday that the automaker is focusing on hybrid production in the U.S. market, a shift from his predecessor's focus on fully-electric models.】

item.title: 美国允许与卢克石油公司在俄罗斯境外的加油站进行交易，直至 4 月下旬
item.description: 特朗普政府周四批准了与卢克石油公司（Lukoil）在俄罗斯境外的零售加油站的交易，对美国10月份因该公司的收入在支持莫斯科的乌克兰战争中所扮演的角色而实施的制裁作出了窄幅豁免。【原文：The Trump administration on Thursday authorized transactions with Lukoil retail gas stations outside of Russia, issuing a narrow waiver to sanctions the U.S. imposed in October for the role the company's revenues play in supporting Moscow's war in Ukraine.】

item.title: Prada 旗下范思哲在短暂任职后与首席创意官达里奥-维塔利分道扬镳
item.description: 意大利时装公司范思哲创意总监达里奥-维塔莱（Dario Vitale）周四表示，他在范思哲任职仅几个月后将离开该品牌。【原文：Versace's creative director Dario Vitale is leaving the brand after only a few months in the role, the Italian fashion company said on Thursday.】

item.title: 铜业巨头自由港首席执行官不指望兼并实现增长
item.description: 铜业巨头 Freeport-McMoRan 公司首席执行官周四表示，对于并购机会永远不会说 "不"，但该公司并不指望通过交易实现增长。【原文：Copper giant Freeport-McMoRan would never say never for merger and acquisition opportunities, but the company is not counting on deals for growth, its chief executive said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国称燃油经济性新规可能导致旅行车回归
item.description: 特朗普政府表示，其新的燃油经济性退坡提案可能会允许汽车制造商恢复生产旅行车，这是 20 世纪 70 年代和 80 年代家庭旅行的主力车型。【原文：The Trump administration says its new fuel economy rollback proposal could allow automakers to resume building station wagons, a staple of 1970s and '80s family travel.】

item.title: 美国 9 月份工厂订单增幅低于预期
item.description: 由于制造商仍然受到关税的制约，9 月份美国工厂商品新订单的增幅低于预期。【原文：New orders for U.S. factory goods increased less than expected in September as manufacturers remained constrained by tariffs.】

item.title: 比亚迪加速南非扩张，计划于 2026 年在南非开设更多经销店
item.description: 中国汽车制造商比亚迪将实现到 2026 年第一季度在南非拥有约 35 家经销店的初步目标，并计划随着电动汽车需求的增长，到明年年底将经销网络扩大到 60 至 70 家。【原文：Chinese automaker BYD will hit its initial target of having about 35 dealerships in South Africa by the first quarter of 2026 and aims to expand that network to 60 to 70 by the end of next year along with growing demand for its electric vehicles.】

item.title: 威士忌制造商布朗-福尔曼第二季度销售额超出预期，坚持实现年度目标
item.description: 杰克-丹尼尔威士忌制造商布朗-福尔曼公司周四的季度销售额超过了华尔街的预期，并维持了其年度预期，因为该公司寄希望于新兴市场对其威士忌的需求来抵消美国市场的疲软。【原文：Jack Daniel's maker Brown-Forman on Thursday beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly sales and maintained its annual forecasts as the company banks on demand for its whiskeys in emerging markets to offset softness in the U.S.】

item.title: 美国全国广播公司（NBC）高管在特朗普抨击声中表示支持深夜节目
item.description: NBC 环球影业公司（NBCUniversal Studios）董事长 Pearlena Igbokwe 周四在路透社 NEXT 会议上表示，NBC 广播网将继续支持其受到美国总统唐纳德-特朗普攻击的深夜喜剧节目。【原文：The NBC broadcast network will continue to support its late-night comedy shows that have come under attack from U.S. President Donald Trump, NBCUniversal Studios Chairman Pearlena Igbokwe said at the Reuters NEXT conference on Thursday.】

item.title: 与中央银行就数字支付达成协议后，Visa 计划在叙利亚推出新产品
item.description: Visa周四表示，在与叙利亚中央银行就开发数字支付生态系统的路线图达成协议后，该公司计划在叙利亚开展业务。【原文：Visa said on Thursday that it plans to launch operations in Syria, following an agreement with Syria's central bank on a roadmap to develop a digital payments ecosystem, according to a company statement.】

item.title: 评论平台 Trustpilot 在 Grizzly Research 做空股票后股价暴跌
item.description: 周四，Trustpilot 的股价暴跌超过 30%，此前 Grizzly Research 披露了空头头寸，并指责该全球评论平台创建虚假档案，提供负面评论，然后向公司施压，要求其支付订阅费用。【原文：Trustpilot's shares plunged more than 30% on Thursday after Grizzly Research disclosed a short position and accused the global review platform of creating fake profiles that gave negative reviews and then pressuring companies to pay for subscriptions.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Meta 将削减多达 30% 的 Metaverse 预算
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引熟悉相关讨论的人士的话报道，Meta 预计将为其 Metaverse 计划削减多达 30% 的预算。【原文：Meta is expected to make up to 30% budget cuts for its Metaverse initiative, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the discussion.】

item.title: 印度风险投资公司 Nexus 成立 7 亿美元基金，支持人工智能和消费初创企业
item.description: 印度 Nexus Venture Partners 公司周三宣布，它完成了一项 7 亿美元的基金，该基金将支持人工智能、企业软件、消费和金融科技初创企业。【原文：India's Nexus Venture Partners announced on Wednesday that it closed a $700 million fund that will back AI, enterprise software, consumer and fintech startups.】

item.title: 尽管决策者意见不一，经济学家仍加倍看好美联储 12 月减息
item.description: 据路透社调查，100 多位经济学家中的大多数认为，美国联邦储备委员会将在 12 月 9 日至 10 日的政策会议上把关键利率下调四分之一个百分点，以支持冷却的劳动力市场。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve will reduce its key interest rate by a quarter-percentage point at the December 9-10 policy meeting to support a cooling labour market, according to a majority of over 100 economists surveyed by Reuters.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数降至三年多来最低水平
item.description: 上周，新申请失业救济金的美国人数降至三年多来的最低水平，但仍未显示出劳动力市场状况恶化的迹象。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits dropped to the lowest level in more than three years last week, still showing no signs of a deterioration in labor market conditions.】

item.title: 芝加哥联储认为 11 月失业率稳定在 4.4%，因为其他数据显示就业岗位减少
item.description: 芝加哥联储周四估计，11月份美国失业率维持在4.4%左右不变，而一家私营供应商提供的密切关注的数据进一步证明，美国劳动力市场正在缓慢减弱。【原文：The U.S. unemployment rate was unchanged around 4.4% in November, the Chicago Federal Reserve estimated on Thursday, while closely watched data from a private provider added to the evidence that the U.S. labor market is slowly weakening.】

item.title: 纽约时报》就新闻采访权起诉五角大楼
item.description: 纽约时报》周四起诉美国国防部和国防部长皮特-黑格塞斯（Pete Hegseth），试图迫使五角大楼放弃其限制性的新新闻政策，这是美国新闻机构重新获得进入政府空间的最新尝试。【原文：The New York Times sued the U.S. Department of Defense and Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth on Thursday in an effort to force the Pentagon to abandon its restrictive new press policy, the latest attempt by a U.S. news organization to reclaim access to government spaces.】

item.title: 克罗格第三季度销售额不及预期，原因是购物者缩减开支
item.description: 由于对价格敏感的购物者和经济不确定性影响了对食品杂货和新鲜农产品的需求，克罗格公司周四的第三季度销售额未能达到华尔街的预期。【原文：Kroger missed Wall Street estimates for third-quarter sales on Thursday as price-sensitive shoppers and economic uncertainty weighed on demand for its groceries and fresh produce.】

item.title: 荷美尔食品公司因价格上涨而预测年度利润高于预期
item.description: 花生酱生产商霍梅尔食品公司（Hormel Foods）周四预计全年利润将超过预期，该公司相信其成本削减计划、价格上涨以及对火鸡肉的持续需求将克服牛肉和猪肉的高投入成本。【原文：Skippy peanut butter maker Hormel Foods forecast annual profit above estimates on Thursday, betting that its cost-cutting plan, higher prices and sustained demand for turkey will overcome high input costs of beef and pork.】

item.title: 雪花公司股价下跌，因预测第四季度产品收入增长放缓
item.description: 周四盘前交易中，Snowflake 股价暴跌 8%，原因是这家云数据分析公司预测第四季度产品收入增长放缓，部分原因是长期大额交易提供的折扣。【原文：Snowflake shares slumped 8% in premarket trading on Thursday after the cloud data analytics company forecast slower product revenue growth for the fourth quarter, partly hit by discounts offered on the large, long-term deals.】

item.title: 消息人士称，激进投资者利特敦促第一工业地产公司进行改革以提振股价
item.description: 据熟悉此事的消息人士透露，激进投资者乔纳森-利特（Jonathan Litt）希望仓库运营商第一工业房地产信托公司（First Industrial Realty Trust）出售资产、向股东返还资本并更新董事会，这些措施可能会使股价上涨 30%。【原文：Activist investor Jonathan Litt wants warehouse operator First Industrial Realty Trust to sell assets, return capital to shareholders and refresh its board, steps that could boost the stock price by 30%, according to sources familiar with the matter and a document seen by Reuters.】

item.title: Signature 银行前高管创办区块链银行
item.description: 在这家以服务加密货币客户而闻名的纽约银行倒闭近三年后，前 Signature Bank 高管正在推出一家新的基于区块链的银行，专注于促进即时、全天候的美元支付。【原文：Former Signature Bank executives are launching a new blockchain-based bank focused on facilitating instant, around-the-clock U.S. dollar payments, nearly three years after the collapse of the New York-based bank known for serving cryptocurrency clients.】

item.title: AMC 称 Aron 在轻微中风后将继续担任连锁影院首席执行官
item.description: 连锁影院 AMC Entertainment 周四表示，首席执行官亚当-阿隆（Adam Aron）在上个月轻微中风后将继续留任。【原文：Theater chain AMC Entertainment said on Thursday that chief executive officer Adam Aron will continue in his role after suffering a minor stroke last month.】

item.title: 挑战者公司称美国 11 月计划裁员下降 53
item.description: 由于企业在不确定的经济环境中艰难前行，招聘意向持续低迷。【原文：Hiring intentions continued to lag as businesses navigated an uncertain economic environment.】
